docblock.long-description: These varaibles are the GLOBAL crypto and security schema. EG: When we're storing data in sessions, we encrypt it. When user data is written to the database, their own IV and Key are used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Global KEY used for encryption

tag.name: param
tag.description: The global IV used for encryption

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the cipher we want to use. For security, this should stay as Rijndael

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ciphermode we want to use. For security, this should stay as CBC (Cipher-Block Chaining)

docblock.long-description: All of these variables are pulled from the database

tag.name: param
tag.description: The host address

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Server-Admin username (the query user)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The encrypted server-admin password

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Port that the Query should use to connect to

tag.name: param
tag.description: The port used for actually connecting to the TS server (for clients)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The TeamSpeak Group ID that members of the parent (ruling) alliance should be put in to

tag.name: param
tag.description: The TeamSpeak Group ID that users found on the whitelist (renters, for example) should be added to

tag.name: param
tag.description: This is going to be a quickly depreciated variable, but for now lets describe it as the flag for formatting TICKERS in TeamSpeak

tag.name: param
tag.description: Should we set/use the secure flag when we're using cookies? If TRUE, you must be on an SSL connection, or cookies will never work

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ABSOLUTE path where the Pheal library can cache XML documents

tag.description: Haven't you heard? I thought everyone had heard... Bird bird bird, the bird is the wo.. No, wait. "connect" is the only string accepted. Empty, or anything else, the connection to the db closes.

docblock.long-description: When we instantiate this class, we must remember to use __construct to our advantage. All variables passed to __construct should be populated within a session variable, set by the instantiation of Config Instantiate via $class = new Crypto($iv, $key, [optional]$cipher, [optional]$cipherMode);

tag.name: param
tag.description: REQUIRED: The Initialization Vector for this session

tag.name: param
tag.description: REQUIRED: The Key to be used for this session

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Cipher to use (defaults to MRCYPT_RIJNDAEL_256)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The encryption mode to use (defaults to MCRYPT_MODE_CBC)

docblock.long-description: This function ecnrypts a string, based on the parameters passed to it Note: This function will ALWAYS return something, even if it's not what you want. A string is the returned result. Make sure that when you instantiate this class, you set your varaibles properly!

tag.name: param
tag.description: The unencrypted string to encrypt

tag.name: param
tag.description: TRUE or FALSE - ENCODE our encrypted string before returning (DEFAULT: TRUE)

docblock.long-description: This function decrypts a string, based on the parameters passed to it Note: This function will ALWAYS return something, even if it's not what you want. A string is the returned result. Make sure that when you instantiate this class, you set your varaibles properly!

tag.name: param
tag.description: The encrypted string, which CAN be base64 encoded, to decrypt

tag.name: param
tag.description: TRUE or FALSE - Do we need to DECODE our scring before ecnryption (DEFAULT: TRUE)

docblock.long-description: This class is an attempt at condensing all of our exceptions being thrown into an easy to manage interface. When an exception is thrown, the idea here is that you'll pass it an exception type (see params) and something different will be done wtih that exception.

tag.name: param
tag.description: string This is the supplimentary error string passed to our exception

tag.name: param
tag.description: int This is an integer value that indicates the type of exception we need to prepare to handle. 0 is default, a default exception. 1 for a MySQL exception, 2 for a pheal exception.

tag.name: param
tag.description: obj This is an optional (suggested) pre-existing exception to be passed (and parsed and logged) so we can backtrace through the stack

property.name: $message
property.default: 'YOU FORGOT TO SET AN EXCEPTION MESSAGE'

docblock.long-description: Our magic method to actually make our exception
Convert our object to a string, we want to see everything that happened

We want to log all exceptions as well as display them, so we can go back through stacks and see what's breaking, where and why (hopefully) Note: We need to make sure that /var/log/evespeak/error.log is writable by our PHP installation.

tag.name: param
tag.description: string The textual representation of what our exception is about. eg: Pheal, PhealAPI, PhealGood, MySQL etc

tag.name: param
tag.description: bool TRUE if the file was written into successfully, FALSE if the file could be written to, or opened for that matter.

docblock.long-description: Our custom exception to do something with mysql issues
Our custom exception to do something when phealgood pukes.
Custom function do deal with PHEAL when it pukes
Custom function deal with phealAPI issues (eg: bad api info)
